00020 /******************************************************************************/
00021 
00022 #ifndef VMI_MODEL_INFO_H
00023 #define VMI_MODEL_INFO_H
00024 
00025 #include "vmi/vmiTyperefs.h"
00026 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00027 #include "hostapi/impTypes.h"
00028 
00029 #if (IMPERAS_WINDOWS==1)
00030 #    define VMI_EXE_SUFFIX ".exe"
00031 #else
00032 #    define VMI_EXE_SUFFIX ""
00033 #endif
00034 
00035 typedef struct vmiVlnvInfoS {
00036     const char  *vendor;
00037     const char  *library;
00038     const char  *name;
00039     const char  *version;
00040 } vmiVlnvInfo, *vmiVlnvInfoP;
00041 
00042 //
00043 // Data needed by a simulator for processor model.
00044 //
00045 typedef struct vmiProcessorInfoS {
00046 
00047     // Location of this model
00048     vmiVlnvInfo  vlnv;
00049 
00050     // semihost library used by default with this model.
00051     vmiVlnvInfo  semihost;
00052 
00053     // Path to the gdb used to debug this model.
00054     // Remember to use the VMI_EXE_SUFFIX so this works on Windows
00055     const char  *gdbPath;
00056 
00057     // Flags (if any) required by this GDB for this processor
00058     const char  *gdbFlags;
00059 
00060     // Startup commands (if any) sent to this GDB for this processor
00061     // Separate and terminate each command with newline (\n)
00062     // e.g. "command one\ncommand two\n"
00063     const char  *gdbInitCommands;
00064 
00065     // CPU Helper used by this model
00066     vmiVlnvInfo  helper;
00067 
00068     // If endianFixed is true, this is it, otherwise ignore it.
00069     memEndian    endian;
00070 
00071     // This model supports one endian
00072     Bool         endianFixed;
00073 
00074     // By default, choose this model to execute a program with the following
00075     // elf code. Only one model in your library should have this set.
00076     Bool         defaultModel;
00077 
00078     // When reading executables for this model, the loader should use
00079     // physical addresses, not virtual.
00080     // (This is a legacy feature; unlikely to be required).
00081     Bool         loadPhysical;
00082 
00083     // True if this model can run in QuantumLeap mode
00084     Bool         QLQualified;
00085 
00086     // standard ELF code used by this processors
00087     Uns32        elfCode;
00088 
00089     // Alternative ELF codes used by this processor
00090     const Uns32 *alternativeElfCodes;
00091 
00092     // Deprecated field
00093     const char  *variant;
00094 
00095     // Processor family string
00096     const char  *family;
00097 
00098     // Processor group strings
00099     const char  *groupH;
00100     const char  *groupL;
00101 
00102     // If the gdb associated with this processor sets the lower address bits
00103     // to indicate the processor mode, use this field to clear the bits prior
00104     // to setting a breakpoint.
00105     //  =0 or 1 if no snap required
00106     //  =2 to snap to 2-byte short
00107     //  =4 to snap to 4-byte word
00108     //  =8 to snap to 8-byte long word
00109 
00110     Uns32        debugSnapAddress;
00111 
00112 } vmiProcessorInfo;
00113 
00114 //
00115 // Type of function called by simulator to get general info about this model
00116 //
00117 #define VMI_PROC_INFO_FN(_NAME) vmiProcessorInfoCP _NAME ( \
00118     vmiProcessorP processor \
00119 )
00120 
00121 typedef VMI_PROC_INFO_FN((*vmiProcessorInfoFn));
00122 
00123 #endif
